etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in Journal of the Chemical Society. From German Protopin from proto- + op- (in Opium, in which protopine was first found) + -in

definitions: A white crystalline alkaloid present in many plants, especially of the families Papaveraceae and Fumariaceae.

notes.text: Protopine has a pentacyclic structure. Formula: C₂₀H₁₉NO₅.
